text: [Music]
hey guys it's tidy and this is my 2001
integrate the crosser so not too long
ago I replaced my distributor oh ring
and found that my cap and rotor were
warmed out and so I told my fiance to
stop by the Honda dealership to get a
brand new cap and rotor and he was able
to bring them home pretty early today so
I'm gonna replace them today so let's
get to it
okay before we start working on the
distributor we want to unplug it for
safety so you're gonna push this down to
get the clip out and then you're going
to press on this I can push it over here
so the Deuter cap is held on by three
eight millimeter bolts that also have
Phillips heads on them as well
I recommend using a socket and ratchet
to remove them instead of a Phillips
screwdriver there are less chances of
you stripping them so here's a close-up
of where the bolts are so that's one two
and the last one is underneath here
that's the last one
also you should keep in mind that the
cap actually catches the balls and so
they're not gonna go all the way out so
to remove the rotor you need to remove a
screw through this opening right here
currently the screw is on this side so
you're gonna have to turn the motor over
to get it to this side okay one more
time a little bit more got it
so for close-up that's the screw that
you're going to need to remove to remove
the rotor so you're gonna need a Philips
screwdriver so I got the screw out
sometimes they pop right off and
sometimes you have to wiggle them off
but looks like mine just pops right off
so every time you replace the cap you
want to also replace this gasket that's
on the distributor so for this you're
gonna need a pick
so that's the old one and this is the
new one
okay so now we're gonna put the new
rotor on
and in this gruel
okay so now we're gonna put the new cap
on I like to hand tighten the bolts
first before finally securing them in
place
so the next thing we need to do is to
transfer it over the wires to the new
cap and then finally reconnect
everything and we should be good to go
[Music]
the last thing we need to do is just to
plug everything back up and then we're
done
so that's pretty much how you replace
